title: Which issues divided Americans most significantly during the culture wars of the 1980s and 1990s? - Quora
tags: Culture of the United States of America
History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Mostly irrelevant (in hindsight) cultural issues that had mostly to do with lingering animosities left over from the 1960s and, by extension, 1970s. The freedoms that had burst into daily life during the Consciousness Revolution (‘60s and ‘70s) were entrenched enough by the ‘80s, and certainly by the ‘90s, as to be essentially impervious to attack, yet the right could not live with these changes and set about reversing them to the greatest extent possible. The fight over the National Endowment for the Arts, beginning in ’81 and stretching into the Nineties, provides a great example of the fight between those who were attempting to save the humanistic legacy of the Sixties from those who would have it destroyed.  Senator Tankerbelle discusses Funding for the Arts. Mr Show S1:E2 (1995). Be sure to watch the entire clip so you won’t miss out on the Valdosta Folk Festival and Jelly Off!

Whether the song states: “My bologna has a first name, it's O-S-C-A-R! My bologna has a second name, it's M-E-Y-E-R!” OR “My bologna has a first name, it's H-O-M-E-R! My bologna has a second name, it's H-O-M-E-R!”
